intro: Acraea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved acraea, is a species of butterfly found in various parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Nymphalidae and is characterized by its striking blue and black wing patterns. The plant serves as a host for the larvae of this butterfly, which feed on its leaves. Acraea parvifolia typically grows in open woodland and savanna habitats. Its leaves are small, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
